definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Like all marriages , they have their ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 就像所有的婚姻一样，他们也时好时坏。

sentences.english: When your good and bad, I can be when everything did not happen.
sentences.chinese: 沵的时好时坏，我都可以当佐什么都没有发生。

sentences.english: Macroeconomic choppiness is holding back more dramatic market euphoria.
sentences.chinese: 宏观经济时好时坏，抑制了更乐观的市场情绪。

sentences.english: They can have their good days and bad days.
His administration’s handling of the financial crisis alternated between shaky and competent.
sentences.chinese: 布什政府处理金融危机的能力也时好时坏。

sentences.english: In early phase of rheumatoid arthritis, the disease is characterized by remissions and relapses.
sentences.chinese: 类风湿关节炎的早期特征是时好时坏。

sentences.english: He and his wife and three daughters saw both good times and bad times.
sentences.chinese: 他和他的妻子和三个女儿看到时好时坏倍。

definition: to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
a turn for the better/to pick up/to improve
to get better/to improve/to get well
